alert.note: Alert for Big Stone; Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 30 at 10:13AM CDT until April 01 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 13 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of west central Minnesota and central, north central and northeast South Dakota. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing drizzle or freezing rain is possible at the start of this storm, with winds and blizzard conditions developing through the course of the day Friday.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
